history.proof: intros A B M O H1 H2 H3. shelve.

ctx: intros A B M O H1 H2 H3.
exceptions.tactic: apply (triangle_rectangle A B M O H1 H2).
exceptions.exn: In environment A, B, M, O : PO H1 : isocele O M A H2 : isocele O M B H3 : R (cons (vec O A) (vec O B)) pi The term "A" has type "PO" while it is expected to have type "isocele ?O ?M ?A".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall A B M O : PO, isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> R (cons (vec O A) (vec O B)) pi -> orthogonal (vec M A) (vec M B)

Premises:
*** [ R : AV -> AV -> Prop ]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
isocele = fun A B C : PO => R (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)) : PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
*** [ PO : Type ]
*** [ vec : PO -> PO -> V ]
*** [ pi : AV ]
*** [ cons : V -> V -> AV ]
orthogonal = fun u v : V => R (double (cons u v)) pi : V -> V -> Prop
triangle_rectangle : forall A B M O : PO, isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> orthogonal (vec M A) (vec M B) -> R (cons (vec O A) (vec O B)) pi
angle_inscrit : forall A B M O : PO, isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> R (double (cons (vec M A) (vec M B))) (cons (vec O A) (vec O B))
isocele_permute : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A C) (vec A B)) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B C)))) pi
triangle_isocele : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (double (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)))) pi
somme_triangle : forall A B C : PO, R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (plus (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)))) pi
opp_vect : forall A B : PO, vR (opp (vec A B)) (vec B A)
v_vec : forall (u : V) (A : PO), exists B : PO, vR u (vec A B)
ssrbool.if_expr : forall A : Type, bool -> A -> A -> A
BinInt.Z.le_ind : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m -> A (BinInt.Z.succ m)) -> forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m
Refl.make_impl : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop -> Prop
ssrfun.tag = projT1 : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type), {x : A & P x} -> A Arguments ssrfun.tag {A}%type_scope {P}%function_scope
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
non_vide_P : exists A : PO, A = A
orthogonal_sym : forall u v : V, orthogonal u v -> orthogonal v u
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Refl.make_impl_true : forall (A : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Refl.make_impl eval l True
regulier_cons : forall u v w t s : V, R (cons u v) (cons u w) -> R (cons u t) (cons u s) -> R (cons v t) (cons w s)
reflexion : forall i u v u' v' : V, R (cons u' i) (cons i u) -> R (cons v' i) (cons i v) -> R (cons u v) (cons v' u')
ssrbool.mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T) => let '{| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} as pT0 := pT return (ssrbool.pred_sort pT0 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T) in fun A : ssrbool.pred_sort {| ssrbool.pred_sort := pred_sort; ssrbool.topred := toP |} => ssrbool.Mem (T:=T) (fun x : T => toP A x) : forall (T : Type) (pT : ssrbool.predType T), ssrbool.pred_sort pT -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem {T}%type_scope {pT} A : rename, simpl never
vR_R_compatible : forall u u' v v' : V, vR u u' -> vR v v' -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
R_permute : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u v) (cons w t) -> R (cons v u) (cons t w)
rotation : forall u v u' v' : V, R (cons u u') (cons v v') -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
double_permute : forall u v w t : V, R (double (cons u v)) (double (cons w t)) -> R (double (cons v u)) (double (cons t w))
Ring_theory.pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.N -> R
angle_plat : forall u : V, R (cons u (opp u)) pi
oppu_u : forall u : V, R (cons (opp u) u) pi
oppu_v : forall u v : V, R (cons (opp u) v) (plus pi (cons u v))
Ring_theory.ARmul_1_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rI) x
Ring_theory.ARmul_0_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rO) rO
somme_permute : forall u v w : V, R (plus (cons v u) (plus (cons (opp u) w) (cons (opp w) (opp v)))) pi
somme_pi : forall u v w : V, R (plus (cons u v) (plus (cons w (opp u)) (cons (opp v) (opp w)))) pi
Ring_theory.ARmul_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO
Ring_theory.ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
Ring_theory.rpow_pow_N : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R), Ring_theory.power_theory rI rmul req Cp_phi rpow -> forall (r : R) (n : BinNums.N), req (rpow r (Cp_phi n)) (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul r n)
Ring_theory.ARmul_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)
